intro: Adenophorus minutus, commonly known as the small-fruited adenophorus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Adenophorus minutus is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
